events.originalText: Vivianne Miedema scored six goals and had four assists for Arsenal W.F.C. in their 11–1 victory over Bristol City W.F.C. that broke the record for the most goals scored in a FA Women's Super League match.
events.subtitle: Vivianne Miedema
events.headline: Vivianne Miedema scores six goals in record-breaking victory for Arsenal W.F.C.

events.originalText: A referendum held to ratify the  Act of Declaration of Independence of Ukraine passed with more than 92 percent of the vote.
events.subtitle: 1991 Ukrainian independence referendum
events.headline: Ukraine's Act of Declaration of Independence ratified with over 92% of the vote

events.originalText: Five armed men hijacked a bus carrying schoolchildren and a teacher in Ordzhonikidze (now Vladikavkaz, Russia), and were later given an Ilyushin Il-76 aircraft and ransom for the release of the hostages.
events.subtitle: 1988 Ordzhonikidze bus hijacking
events.headline: Armed men hijack bus in Ordzhonikidze, Russia, demand aircraft and ransom

events.originalText: A period of political and economic reforms in the Socialist Republic of Croatia came to an end as the League of Communists of Yugoslavia decided to purge the state's reformist leadership.
events.subtitle: Croatian Spring
events.headline: League of Communists of Yugoslavia purges reformist leadership in Croatia

events.originalText: The Pit, one of U.S. college basketball's premier arenas, opened on the campus of the University of New Mexico.
events.subtitle: The Pit (arena)
events.headline: The Pit opens at University of New Mexico as premier college basketball arena

events.originalText: The first Gävle goat, a Swedish Yule goat tradition, was constructed in Gävle and then burned to the ground on New Year's Eve.
events.subtitle: Gävle goat
events.headline: First Gävle goat burned in Swedish tradition on New Year's Eve

events.originalText: Twelve countries signed the Antarctic Treaty, the first arms control agreement established during the Cold War, banning military activity in the Antarctic and setting the continent aside as a scientific preserve.
events.subtitle: Antarctic Treaty System
events.headline: Twelve countries sign Antarctic Treaty, banning military activity in the region

events.originalText: The musical Flower Drum Song by Rodgers and Hammerstein premiered on Broadway.
events.subtitle: Flower Drum Song
events.headline: Rodgers and Hammerstein's Flower Drum Song premieres on Broadway

events.originalText: In a key event in the civil rights movement, Rosa Parks was arrested for refusing to give up her seat on a public bus to a white man in Montgomery, Alabama, sparking the Montgomery bus boycott.
events.subtitle: Civil rights movement
events.headline: Rosa Parks arrested for refusing to give up bus seat in Montgomery, Alabama

events.originalText: American men's magazine Playboy was founded in Chicago by Hugh Hefner and his associates.
events.subtitle: Playboy
events.headline: Playboy magazine founded in Chicago by Hugh Hefner

events.originalText: In "one of Australia's most profound mysteries", the body of an unidentified man was found on Somerton beach in Adelaide, a case which remains unsolved.
events.subtitle: Somerton Man
events.headline: Unidentified man found dead on Somerton beach in Adelaide, case remains unsolved

events.originalText: The Civil Air Patrol, the civilian auxiliary of the United States Air Force, was founded.
events.subtitle: Civil Air Patrol
events.headline: Civil Air Patrol founded as civilian auxiliary of U.S. Air Force

events.originalText: Soviet politician Sergei Kirov was assassinated at the Smolny Institute in Leningrad.
events.subtitle: Sergei Kirov
events.headline: Soviet politician Sergei Kirov assassinated in Leningrad

events.originalText: The Gleno Dam in the Italian province of Bergamo failed due to poor workmanship, flooding the downstream valley and killing at least 356 people.
events.subtitle: Gleno Dam
events.headline: Gleno Dam failure in Italy leads to flooding and at least 356 deaths

events.originalText: With the signing of the Act of Union, Denmark recognized the Kingdom of Iceland as a fully sovereign state in personal union through a common monarch.
events.subtitle: Danish–Icelandic Act of Union
events.headline: Denmark recognizes Iceland as fully sovereign state through Act of Union

events.originalText: Returning to Buenos Aires with troops who fought in the Cisplatine War, Juan Lavalle (pictured) deposed provincial governor Manuel Dorrego, reigniting the Argentine Civil Wars.
events.subtitle: Cisplatine War
events.headline: Juan Lavalle deposes provincial governor in Buenos Aires, reignites Civil Wars

events.originalText: Pedro I was crowned the first emperor of Brazil, seven weeks after his reign began on his 24th birthday.
events.subtitle: Pedro I of Brazil
events.headline: Pedro I crowned first emperor of Brazil

events.originalText: Francis Walsingham (pictured), Elizabeth I of England's principal secretary and spymaster, was knighted.
events.subtitle: Francis Walsingham
events.headline: Elizabeth I's spymaster Francis Walsingham knighted
